org.TheGivingChild.Screens

Class ChildSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • org.TheGivingChild.Screens.ChildSprite

  • public class ChildSprite
extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
    ChildSprite controls the behavior for the children within the maze. The main player sprite within the maze is also a ChildSprite, but never utilizes the followSprite method, and has it's own logic for movement within ScreenMaze
    Author:
    Jack Wesley Nelson

      • getFollow

        public boolean getFollow()

        Returns:

      • followSprite

        public void followSprite(ChildSprite leader)
        followSprite(ChildSprite) takes in a ChildSprite as someone to follow. The leader will then add positions to a deque, and the current ChildSprite will then move to the location. If the position is too far away, such as when a child is initially picked up, the movement speed is increased to allow the sprite to catch up. The bufferDistance is meant to scale to the size of the screen.
        Parameters:
        leader - contains the positionQueue of positions to follow.

      • setSpeed
